column1: Lung surgery is surgery done to repair or remove lung tissue.

There are many common lung surgeries, including: - Biopsy of an unknown growth - Lobectomy, to remove one or more lobes of a lung - Lung transplant - Pneumonectomy, to remove a lung - Surgery to prevent the buildup or return of fluid to the chest (pleurodesis) - Surgery to remove an infection or blood in the chest cavity (empyema) - Surgery to remove small balloon-like tissues (blebs) that cause lung collapse (pneumothorax) - Wedge resection, to remove part of a lobe in a lung A thoracotomy is a surgical cut that a surgeon makes to open the chest wall.
Two common ways to do surgery on your lungs are thoracotomy and video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS).
